intro: Spergula tangerina, commonly known as the tangerine sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, where it typically grows in moist, calcareous soils. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are pinkish-white and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early summer. Spergula tangerina is often found in meadows and along stream banks, and it is known for its delicate, aromatic foliage.
